command: Write byte nn to 8042 RAM, byte 0
comments: This byte is also the Command Byte

command: Write bottom 4 bits (0x0) to bottom 4 bits of the Output port
Self-test mouse interface, return result byte
Self-test 8042, return 55h if success, FCh if failure
Self-test keyboard interface, return result byte
Disable keyboard, set bit 4 of Command Byte
Enable keyboard, clear bit 4 of Command Byte

Pulse bits of Output Port low for 6 microseconds. Each zero bit in the command corresponds to the pin on the Output Port. Bit 0 is tied to the reset line on the CPU and command FEh is used to reset the CPU.
